name: Lee Sin
title: the Blind Monk

P.name: Flurry

effects.description: Innate: After casting an ability, Lee Sin's next 2 basic attacks within 3 seconds gain 40% bonus attack speed and restore energy.
The first attack restores 20 / 30 / 40 (based on level) energy and the second attack restores[ half of that amount. ][ 10 / 15 / 20 (based on level) energy. ]

P.notes: Flurry will still restore energy even if the attacks are  dodged,  blocked, or  missed.
P.blurb: After Lee Sin uses an ability, his next 2 basic attacks gain 40% Attack Speed and return 20/10 Energy.

Q.name: Sonic Wave

effects.description: Active: Lee Sin fires a sonic blast in the target direction, dealing physical damage to the first enemy it hits and marking them for 3 seconds, during which they are revealed.
While the target is marked, Lee Sin can cast Resonating Strike.

Q.notes: Sonic Wave will cast from wherever Lee Sin is at the start of the cast time.
Q.blurb: Lee Sin projects a discordant wave of sound to locate his enemies, dealing physical damage to the first enemy it encounters. If Sonic Wave hits, Lee Sin can cast Resonating Strike for the next 3 seconds.

Q.name: Resonating Strike

effects.description: Active: Lee Sin dashes to the nearby enemy marked by Sonic Wave, consuming the mark upon arrival to deal them physical damage, increased by 0% − 100% (based on target's missing health).

Q.notes:
Lee Sin will follow targets that change locations such as  dashing or  blinking but not those that move to great distances, in which case he will end the dash at their previous position.
Lee Sin will attempt to place himself on top of the target upon arrival.
The damage dealt by Resonating Strike can be negated if the target blinks. Sometimes, Lee Sin will end the dash at their last location but appear on top of the target after a short delay.
Lee Sin will continue dashing even if the target dies or becomes  untargetable, but he will not deal damage.
Resonating Strike cannot be cast without the marked target nearby.
If Resonating Strike interrupts another dash,  Tempest and  Dragon's Rage can be cast during it (both otherwise cannot be cast).


Attacking

Disabled

 Safeguard,  Iron Will, and  Cripple can be cast.  Tempest and  Dragon's Rage are disabled.

Q.blurb: Lee Sin dashes to the enemy hit by Sonic Wave, dealing physical damage.

W.name: Safeguard

effects.description: Active: Lee Sin dashes to the target allied unit's location. If the ally is a champion, both they and Lee Sin are granted a shield for 2 seconds upon his arrival and Safeguard's cooldown is halved. Lee Sin can self-cast Safeguard to shield himself.
If Safeguard is used, Lee Sin can cast Iron Will within the next 3 seconds at no delay.

W.notes:
Lee Sin cannot self-cast Safeguard even while  grounded or  rooted.
Safeguard can be used on any targetable allied unit excluding structures.
This includes  champions,  minions,  wards, and champion summoned units (e.g.  Noxious Trap,  Demacian Standard,  Dark Passage).
If Safeguard's dash interrupts another dash,  Tempest and  Dragon's Rage can be cast during it (both otherwise cannot be cast).
W.blurb: Lee Sin rushes to target ally, shielding himself from damage. If the ally is a champion, they are also shielded. After using Safeguard, Lee Sin can cast Iron Will for the next 3 seconds.

W.name: Iron Will

effects.description: Active: Lee Sin gains bonus life steal and bonus spell vamp for 4 seconds.

W.blurb: Lee Sin's intense training allows him to thrive in battle. For 4 seconds, Lee Sin gains Life Steal and Spell Vamp.

E.name: Tempest

effects.description: Active: Lee Sin smashes the ground beneath him, dealing magic damage to nearby enemies, marking them for 4 seconds and, if they are not invisible when struck, revealing them for the same duration.
If Tempest hits an enemy, Lee Sin can cast Cripple within the next 3 seconds after a 0.1-second delay.

E.notes:
Tempest's sight reveal is not removed when Lee Sin casts Cripple (unlike  Sonic Wave's).
Tempest will cast from wherever Lee Sin is at the end of the cast time.
E.blurb: Lee Sin smashes the ground, sending out a shockwave that deals magic damage and reveals enemy units hit. If Tempest hits an enemy, Lee Sin can cast cripple for the next 3 seconds.

E.name: Cripple

effects.description: Active: Lee Sin slows all nearby enemies marked by Tempest for 4 seconds, decaying over the duration.

E.notes:
Tempest's reveal is not removed when Lee Sin casts Cripple.
Cripple cannot be cast without a marked target nearby.
E.blurb: Lee Sin cripples nearby enemies damaged by Tempest, reducing their Movement Speed for 4 seconds. Movement Speed recovers gradually over the duration.

R.name: Dragon's Rage

effects.description: Active: Lee Sin roots the target enemy champion during the cast time after which he roundhouse kicks them, dealing them physical damage and knocking them back over 1 second.
Enemies that collide with the displaced enemy take bonus physical damage and are knocked up for 1 second.

R.notes:
Applies  spell damage to the primary target and  area damage to secondary targets.
The spell indicator for this ability also displays the direction for the knock back relative to Lee Sin's position.
If the target of Dragon Rage  dies initially on the first hit there will be no displacement of any kind.
The  displacement's direction is decided at the moment of impact and not by Lee Sin and his target's relative locations on-cast (the only way for Lee Sin to control where his target is displaced is by using  Flash before the cast time of Dragon's Rage ends).
The collision damage buff of the target remains for the normal duration even if its trajectory is  displaced by another source (i.e -  Headbutt).
The ability will only go on  cooldown after performing the kick.
Because of this, if  Electrocute triggers from the  root and kills the enemy, the ability will not go on cooldown.
If the target becomes  untargetable, leaves  sight, or dies before the cast time completes, Dragon's Rage cancels but does not go on cooldown.
If the  knock back ends normally and is not interrupted early, the target may still knock other enemies for a brief period after they reach their destination.
R.blurb: Lee Sin performs a powerful roundhouse kick launching his target back, dealing physical damage to the target and any enemies they collide with. Enemies the target collides with are knocked into the air for a short duration. This technique was taught to him by Jesse Perring, although Lee Sin does not kick players off the map.

lore: A master of Ionia's ancient martial arts, Lee Sin is a principled fighter who channels the essence of the dragon spirit to face any challenge. Though he lost his sight many years ago, the warrior-monk has devoted his life to protecting his homeland against any who would dare upset its sacred balance. Enemies who underestimate his meditative demeanor will endure his fabled burning fists and blazing roundhouse kicks.

skins.name: Original
skins.lore: A master of Ionia’s ancient martial arts, Lee Sin is a principled fighter who channels the essence of the dragon spirit to face any challenge. Though he lost his sight many years ago, the warrior-monk has devoted his life to protecting his homeland against any who would dare upset its sacred balance. Enemies who underestimate his meditative demeanor will endure his fabled burning fists and blazing roundhouse kicks.

skins.name: Dragon Fist

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive during 2018.

skins.lore: A famed martial artist beloved the world over, Lee Sin prefers to train far away from the public eye, honing his craft in solitude. Rumors claim that he can punch with the fury of a dragon—but if anyone knows for sure, they're not talking.

skins.name: Muay Thai
skins.lore: Known as “the art of eight limbs”, Muay Thai is a multidisciplinary fighting style practiced by boxers for centuries. Lee Sin, who has mastered many forms of hand-to-hand combat, is among its greatest champions.

skins.name: Pool Party
skins.lore: Lee Sin loves the feeling of the sand between his toes, the sound of the crashing waves, and the warm sun against his skin. He also loves a strong coconut drink. Lee Sin likes to party.

skins.name: SKT T1
skins.lore: Honoring Bengi's winning performance as Lee Sin during the 2013 World Championship.

skins.name: Knockout
skins.lore: 'Knockout' Lee Sin is a brutal pit fighter, who made his name in the underground circuit, before leaving the bloody sport for greener, more criminal pastures. He currently sells his services as a “problem-solver” to a select group of monied kingpins.

skins.name: God Fist
skins.lore: The arrogant wielder of the God Fist was once a mortal boy, tasked by his predecessor to defeat the master of each martial arts school while blindfolded, before facing him at the peak of a treacherous mountain. Emerging victorious, the boy assumed his title—as well as his immortal sight.

skins.name: Playmaker
skins.lore: With a sixth sense for openings in any and all situations, Lee Sin can turn the opposing team's sloppy free kick into a once-in-a-lifetime play talked about for generations to come. Though it's his first year in the majors, some are saying there may never be another player like him.

skins.name: Nightbringer
skins.lore: Lee Sin thrives in the heat of combat. An embodiment of passion and fury, he rules over the raw, chaotic emotions of the heart. While his siblings fight for various ideals, Lee Sin fights for the thrill of battle itself, striking with power and unpredictability.

skins.name: Prestige Nightbringer
skins.lore: Fully consumed by chaos and his blind devotion to the thrill of battle, Lee Sin has become night incarnate, gilded by his divinity.

skins.name: FPX

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2020.

skins.lore: Honoring Tian's winning performance as Lee Sin during the 2019 World Championship.

skins.name: Storm Dragon

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a Loot exclusive in the 2020 Worlds event.
This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2020.

skins.lore: A warrior ascetic consumed with an electric passion for justice, Lee Sin climbed the mountain of the storm dragon Ao Shin, hoping to receive his blessing. Having returned from the summit as a legendary Dragonmancer, Lee Sin now doles out thunderous punishment to villains everywhere—ever under the watchful eye of his draconic patron.
